That said, I want to be direct: while we appreciate your strong commitment to enroll, we are not in a position to indicate that an offer to you is likely unless it becomes clear that we will not receive/secure any higher-priority match before the process concludes.

1) We are still holding the seat primarily for the possibility that higher-priority candidates—especially Student_B (and, to a lesser extent, Student_A or Student_D)—may approach us later as outcomes at their higher-ranked schools resolve. While we cannot predict with certainty whether they will apply, it remains realistic enough at round 12 that we are not ready to release the seat.

2) If it becomes clear that no higher-priority candidate will commit to School_C, we would be willing to reconsider you for the open seat at that point. The practical condition is: if we reach the late stage of the process without receiving an [APPLY] from any higher-priority student (or if such an applicant does not accept), we may then be able to extend an offer.

To be concrete, you are welcome to check back again around rounds 18–20; if we are still unmatched and no higher-priority applications are in hand, we can reassess promptly then.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Student_E is on our true priority list (4th), so acceptable. Our higher-priority targets are Student_B, Student_A, Student_D. At round 18 we have still received no APPLYs from any of them, and Student_B in particular has School_C as 2nd choice (after School_E), so they could still come later if rejected elsewhere, but waiting further risks ending unmatched. Given our prior commitment to reassess at round 18 and the lack of any higher-priority applications in hand, accepting Student_E now secures a match with an acceptable candidate rather than risking an empty seat. Once we accept, we cannot take a higher-priority candidate later, but the probability-weighted payoff favors filling now given late stage and no signals of imminent higher-priority APPLYs.
